intro: Copaifera venezuelana var. laxa, commonly known as the Venezuelan copaiba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest regions of Venezuela and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it is known for its aromatic resin, which has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species in its native environment.
